org.kynosarges.tektosyne.geometry

Class RectI

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.kynosarges.tektosyne.geometry.RectI

  • public final class RectI
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a rectangular region in two-dimensional space, using Integer coordinates. RectI contains two immutable PointI locations, defining the opposite corners of a rectangle. Use RectD to represent rectangles with Double coordinates.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static RectI EMPTY
      An empty read-only RectI.
      PointI max
      The greatest coordinates within the RectI.
      PointI min
      The smallest coordinates within the RectI.

      Creates a RectI with the specified PointI coordinates.

    • Field Detail

      • min

        public final PointI min
        The smallest coordinates within the RectI. Both dimensions are equal to or less than the corresponding max dimensions.

      • max

        public final PointI max
        The greatest coordinates within the RectI. Both dimensions are equal to or greater than the corresponding min dimensions.

      • EMPTY

        public static final RectI EMPTY
        An empty read-only RectI. min and max are both set to PointI.EMPTY.

    • Constructor Detail

      • RectI

        public RectI()
        Creates a RectI with all coordinates set to zero. min and max are both set to PointI.EMPTY.

      • RectI

        public RectI(int minX,
             int minY,
             int maxX,
             int maxY)
        Creates a RectI with the specified Integer coordinates.
        Parameters:
        minX - the smallest x-coordinate within the RectI
        minY - the smallest y-coordinate within the RectI
        maxX - the greatest x-coordinate within the RectI
        maxY - the greatest y-coordinate within the RectI
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if maxX is less than minX, or maxY is less than minY

      • RectI

        public RectI(PointI min,
             PointI max)
        Creates a RectI with the specified PointI coordinates.
        Parameters:
        min - the smallest coordinates within the RectI
        max - the greatest coordinates within the RectI
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any dimension of max is less than the corresponding dimension of min
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if min or max is null

    • Method Detail

      • circumscribe

        public static RectI circumscribe(PointI... points)
        Circumscribes a RectI around the specified PointI coordinates. Sets both dimensions of min to the smallest coordinates, and both dimensions of max to the greatest coordinates, found among any points.
        Parameters:
        points - an array of PointI coordinates whose bounds to determine
        Returns:
        the smallest RectI that contains all specified points
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if points is null or empty, or contains any null elements

      • contains

        public boolean contains(int x,
                        int y)
        Determines whether the RectI contains the specified Integer coordinates.
        Parameters:
        x - the x-coordinate to examine
        y - the y-coordinate to examine
        Returns:
        true if both x and y fall within the range of coordinates defined by min and max, else false

      • contains

        public boolean contains(PointI point)
        Determines whether the RectI contains the specified PointI coordinates.
        Parameters:
        point - the PointI to examine
        Returns:
        true if both dimensions of point fall within the range of coordinates defined by min and max, else false
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if point is null

      • contains

        public boolean contains(RectI rect)
        Determines whether the RectI entirely contains the specified instance.
        Parameters:
        rect - the RectI to examine
        Returns:
        true if both min and max of the specified rect fall within the range coordinates defined by this instance, else false
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if rect is null

      • containsOpen

        public boolean containsOpen(int x,
                            int y)
        Determines whether the RectI contains the specified Integer coordinates, excluding the x- and y-coordinates of max.
        Parameters:
        x - the x-coordinate to examine
        y - the y-coordinate to examine
        Returns:
        true if both x and y fall within the range of coordinates defined by min (inclusive) and max (exclusive), else false

      • containsOpen

        public boolean containsOpen(PointI point)
        Determines whether the RectI contains the specified PointD coordinates, excluding the x- and y-coordinates of max.
        Parameters:
        point - the PointI to examine
        Returns:
        true if both dimensions of point fall within the range of coordinates defined by min (inclusive) and max (exclusive), else false
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if point is null

      • distanceVector

        public PointI distanceVector(PointI q)
        Finds the distance vector from the specified PointI coordinates to the nearest edges of the RectI. The returned coordinates are negative if the corresponding dimension of q if less than that of min, and positive if it is greater than max.
        Parameters:
        q - the PointI to examine
        Returns:
        a PointI whose dimensions equal zero if they fall within the corresponding dimensions of min and max, else the signed difference to the nearest edge coordinate
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArithmeticException - if the difference in any dimension overflows Integer
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if q is null

      • fromInts

        public static RectI[] fromInts(int... rects)
        Converts the specified Integer array to a RectI array. The returned array has a quarter as many elements as the specified rects and retains the same coordinate sequence.
        Parameters:
        rects - an array containing the coordinates min.x, min.y, max.x, max.y of RectI instances, stored in successive index positions per RectI
        Returns:
        the RectI array created from rects
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the length of rects is not divisible by four, or if any max coordinate is less than the corresponding min coordinate
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if rects is null

      • height

        public long height()
        Gets the height the RectI. Never negative but may be zero. One less than the actual height if RectI coordinates represent pixels. Coordinates are widened to Long to prevent Integer overflow.
        Returns:
        the difference between the x-coordinates of max and min

      • intersect

        public RectI intersect(RectI rect)
        Finds the intersection of the RectI with the specified instance.
        Parameters:
        rect - the RectI to intersect with this instance
        Returns:
        a RectI that contains the intersection of rect with this instance, if any intersection was found, else null
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if rect is null

      • intersectsWith

        public boolean intersectsWith(RectI rect)
        Determines whether the RectI intersects with the specified instance.
        Parameters:
        rect - the RectI to examine
        Returns:
        true if rect shares any coordinates with this instance, else false
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if rect is null

      • locate

        public RectLocation locate(PointI q)
        Determines the location of the specified PointI relative to the RectI.
        Parameters:
        q - the PointI coordinates to examine
        Returns:
        a RectLocation indicating the location of q relative to the RectD in each dimension
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if q is null

      • offset

        public RectI offset(int x,
                    int y)
        Offsets the RectI by the specified Integer distances.
        Parameters:
        x - the horizontal offset applied to the RectI
        y - the vertical offset applied to the RectI
        Returns:
        a RectI whose min and max equal those of the current instance, with x and y added to all corresponding dimensions
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArithmeticException - if the new coordinates in any dimension overflow Integer

      • offset

        public RectI offset(PointI vector)
        Offsets the RectI by the specified PointI vector.
        Parameters:
        vector - the PointI offset applied to the RectI
        Returns:
        a RectI whose min and max equal those of the current instance, with vector added to both points
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArithmeticException - if the new coordinates in any dimension overflow Integer
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if vector is null

      • toInts

        public static int[] toInts(RectI... rects)
        Converts the specified RectI array to an Integer array. The returned array has four times as many elements as the specified rects and retains the same coordinate sequence.
        Parameters:
        rects - the RectI array to convert
        Returns:
        an array containing the coordinates min.x, min.y, max.x, max.y for all rects, stored in successive index positions per RectI
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if rects or any of its elements is null

      • toRectD

        public RectD toRectD()
        Converts the RectI to a RectD.
        Returns:
        a RectD whose RectD.min and RectD.max points equal the corresponding points of the RectI

      • union

        public RectI union(RectI rect)
        Finds the union of the RectI with the specified instance.
        Parameters:
        rect - the RectI to combine with this instance
        Returns:
        a RectI that contains the union of rect with this instance
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if rect is null

      • width

        public long width()
        Gets the width the RectI. Never negative but may be zero. One less than the actual width if RectI coordinates represent pixels. Coordinates are widened to Long to prevent Integer overflow.
        Returns:
        the difference between the y-coordinates of max and min

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
        Compares the specified Object to this RectI instance.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        obj - the Object to compare to this instance
        Returns:
        true if obj is not null and a RectI instance whose min and max equal those of this instance, else false

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()
        Returns a hash code for the RectI.
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        an Integer hash code for the RectI

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a String representation of the RectI.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a String containing the values of min and max
